result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion Gene Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Early Discharge from probation after 6 months, if determined eligible and approved by the agent

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA Sample
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  If DOT Assessment completed and acceptable, prior assessment can be used - defendant to provide release for agent to get this information.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dion Gene Ferguson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Filed by Defense. Original filed in 15CT-196.

Defendant Dion Gene Ferguson in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT196, 15CM397 and 16CM49.

9:39 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT196:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - No contest 

15CM397:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM49:
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Defendant makes statements on the record.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 on 15CT196 and Count 1 on 16CM49.   Count 1 on 15CT196 is Dismissed and Count 1 on 15CM397 is DRI.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement at this time.

BY THE COURT:
15CT196:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 -
Impose 60 day jail sentence 
45 days jail credit - time served sentence
Pay fine plus costs totalling $1,820
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
29 month DL revocation
29 month IID on any vehicles owned or operated by the defendant - retroactive to today's date 
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Provide DNA sample 
**bond monies to be applied to costs from 15CT196 and 15CM397

15CM397:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM49:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence
15 days jail credit if probation revoked
Placed on Probation for 12 months 
Early discharge from probation after 6 months if determined eligible and approved by agent
**Conditions of Probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  If DOT assessment completed and acceptable prior assessment can be used - defendant to provide
release for agent to get this information.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide a DNA sample
Plea hearing on July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-397, 16CM-49 and 15CT-196.

10:09 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

Defendant is in inpatient treatment, at Tomah VA currently. 
There is a plea agreement.

Matter to be adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

EFFECTIVE 03-14-2016 at 7:00 a.m.: Cash bond amended to this signature bond to allow Defendant be transported to a 35 day program at Tomah VA Medial Center Mental Health Residential Rehabilitation Treatment Substance Abuse Program. Additional conditions of the at the Defendant copmply with all rules of the facility and treatment plan and compu with all follow up recommendations of the treatment program.  If Mr. Ferguson were to violate or not compy with treatment he would be returned to the custody of the Portage County Jail. All other non-monetary conditions remain in effect.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney  Acalia N Halverson in court.   Defendant Dion Gene Ferguson appears by video. Cass Cousins for the State.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. Defendant Dion Gene Ferguson appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
bond cont  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: $1,000 cash bond: Post $500 to get out of jail and sign wage assignment at $100 per paycheck. Comply with all current conditions of bond.

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a bond  with conditions as stated.
Defendant requests a sig bond or wage assignment.
BTC:  $1,000 cash bond: Post $500 to get out of jail and sign wage assignment at $100 per paycheck. Comply with all current conditions of bond.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    2-1-16 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
